Hi All

I've just bagged a Devon Torvette (I think) interior, lots of bits, including the cooler, but it needs a lot of help, some bit need replacing entirely, it doesn't have the drawers and I have very little idea how it fits together. So... any pictures, plans, books that people can point me towards would be great.

Cheers

Sean

Hi Sean

Is your Torvette a 'walk through' or 'bulkhead'?

I also have a Torvette 'bulkhead' version, here is a link to my thread that will give you a bit of info. The Torvette continued on from the Devonette and sold in small numbers, most stumped up for the Caravette instead.

Please share any thing you find, type21f is a great source of knowledge regarding all things Devon as are the rest of the DICS on here.

Good luck with your search. I have made a lot of progress on mine lately, (should update my thread!!).

viewtopic.php?f=46&t=58843

Cheers
Peter

Hi Peter, I'm told it's a bulkhead that someone tried to convert to a walkthru so I'm keen to see a bulkhead model and try to make sense of what I've got. I'll have a look at your thread and if I find out anything new I'll let you know. Cheers Sean

I think the Torvette kind of works like a walkthrough even on the bulkhead version - you still have the two buddy seats but on the non-walkthrough version you have a near full length slider cupboard to go with them. The rear setup is the same either way though - similar to the Caravette Spaceway's I've seen but with extra headbanger cupboard and a double instead of single offside cupboard:

http://www.eurobox-vw.com/devon.htm
(note, the comments are correct, it shouldn't have the mag rack)

The pictures do not show it but I believe the rear seat had an over wheel arch easicool with metal box frame and pull out dicky seat ply board on top with wire support frame/leg. There are pictures of how this looks works on slapper's Spaceway WT bus.

Easicool housing is makeable...BJI has a thread

type21f wrote:
The interior from the Velvet Green Kombi was flat packed and shipped out to NZ for one of the Antipodean DICS to resurrect.



That would be me then ....... all re-finished now. It was mostly complete, a bit rough though! I repaired all the de-laminated veneer, stripped all the old French polish off and mixed up new shellac and recoated. Bus is progressing nicely, new transaxle and engine gone in this last week that I had rebuilt quite some time ago, getting closer to being able to fit the interior.
All panel work completed, repairs have had new paint blended, I am doing everything myself so takes time.

A good amount of info already for you Sean, good luck. Look forward to seeing some photos.

Yep DICS down under...LOL
G

From Edinburgh....shame my wife missed your wife and daughter at the fringe in the summer...
Oh and she reminds me...Thanks for the material...My son had filed the parcel.

There were some 66 period rear drawers and a side drop down shelf instead of the magazine rack for sale in vw parts emporium for ages. I steered several people to look at them... discussed with clymoj.
But checked when I read your post and see they are no longer shown = sold.
I believe when the WT model was introduced VW had the spare wheel mount on the RHD NS complete with wheel well. Because Devon had the tall cupboard on the NS in the 66 MY which covered the wheel trough in the rear ..the Devon conversions moved to have a set of rear drawers which actually had a flat storage area ....On the OS with drop down flap to hold the spare wheel. As in Slapper's slide show..
Not sure if division buses had standard drawers?
Anyone?
Bobley posted pictures of standard drawers you could use to make some standard drawers...but would need someone to post drawings of 66 drawers....If you wanted to go that way..
Sure bu5nut would make you some..
Bus colourway looks really nice...
G
I think Richard (rdean) took the Spaceway side flap and easicool pull out seat from partsemporium to fill in the gaps on the Caravette Spaceway interior I sold him.
